channel.title: Epidemiology on Open Plant Pathology
channel.description: Recent content in Epidemiology on Open Plant Pathology

item.title: What is going on in OPP? a quick summary of the first five months
item.description: OPP was created in early January and we had no idea how OPP would be received and whether it would catch interest and be sustainable. In this post, we provide a brief summary of major achievements during the first five months of OPP.

item.title: Adam Sparks
item.description: Founder. Plant pathologist and epidemiologist. University of Southern Queensland, Australia

item.title: Emerson Del Ponte
item.description: Founder. Plant disease epidemiologist. Universidade Federal de Viçosa, Brazil

item.title: Neil McRoberts
item.description: Plant disease epidemiologist and modeller. University of California - Davis, USA

item.title: Paul Esker
item.description: Plant disease epidemiologist and modeller. Pennsylvania State University, USA

item.title: Sydney Everhart
item.description: Plant disease epidemiologist and population biologist. University of Nebraska, USA

item.title: Are you a scientist dealing with computational plant pathology? Then let's connect and code together!
item.description: A community call for plant epidemiologists, pathogen population biologists, molecular ecologists and mathematical modelers to join a network for promoting data sharing and open tools.

item.title: Kaique dos S. Alves
item.description: MSc student. Universidade Federal de Viçosa. Disease modeling and risk assessment.

item.title: Lisa Ann Rothmann
item.description: Lecturer and Phd Student. Free State University. Risk modeling and management of vegetables and cereal crop diseases

item.title: Mladen Čučak
item.description: Phd student Maynooth University, Ireland. Disease modeling and forecasting.

item.title: Muhammad Mohsin Raza
item.description: PhD Student. Iowa State University, USA. Epidemiology, remote sensing and machine learning
